header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Future plans, writing, politics, tattoos, the domestic sphere, describing a perfect day
header.activity: Husband and Wife taking about their future holiday plans then discussing various hypothetical situations

oh right okay here's a question for you erm what amendments these these cards must have been made in America so the question is what amendments should be made to the US Constitution?

hmm well nice er hmm the main one that I know of and thought about is the need to explicitly mention the right to property so they've got if you remember the the what's in the Declaration of Independence
I know very very little about it I'm ashamed to say
something about inalienable rights to er life liberty and the pursuit of happiness

along those lines anyway so right to life no-one really argues about that liberty means can't lock you up unless there's good reason to er pursuit of happiness I think it should even if it doesn't say it say the pursuit of your own happiness as opposed to making everyone else happy
mm mm mm mm

which otherwise you'd just be back into slavery but yeah the bit they're missing there is property because erm America despite being a very individualist capitalist country over the years er and particularly right now with Obamacare has decided it's going to not let you be free they're going to tell you what to do and take your property away well all the time though in America unlike this country whenever anything comes up they often refer to the Constitution and say that's unconstitutional and and you know an individual can bring a court case that will go all the way to the Supreme Court if they can make a case for the fact that it is to do with the Constitution so if you put in a line there about erm property probably something else about interstate commerce as well people justify the regulations they have now loads of them they have these federal regulations like er what you can and can't do with guns and stuff based on

what makes a house a home?

oh that's a good one as I as I sit here in in our beautiful home which has been largely made by your good self er well you could look at the I wouldn't say superficial but not in the sense of unimportant but you could say decoration and tidiness so that you can it's not just a big mess it's actually our home which is a lovely place to come to every evening and to wake up in because it's beautifully arranged and aesthetically pleasing and has colour schemes and objects of value around the place erm so many things that make it very erm personal and pleasant place to be er so that would be you know the sort of physical things but then you could look on the more spiritual level and you could say well is a house a home is where I suppose it's where things like the artefacts come in

you know the things that you put in place aren't just there for utilitarian purposes if you were say sharing a flat or you were in a barracks you know there's your suit there's your knife and fork there's your blanket that's it
